comments.text:
From President House take bus 3. Walk a bit further from the last stop.

siberian_explorer

Here is a parking for trucks. Talk with truck drivers. Direct lifts to Dushanbe, Ayni, Khujand.

siberian_explorer
Perfect spot to get towards Dushanbe
Hitchhiking here is easy. Just saying 'bez dengi" it means without money on Russian language. Many taxi drivers but still you can flnd nice eople
Great spot for hitchhiking to any direction. Got free ride to Khojund in a minute. The road is super scenic. 2 Guys

Take a bus until the final stop(terminal), escape the taxi drivers and go past the gate. If you walk a bit there is a bunch of great spots. Keep in mind, that the karamyk border crossing to kyrgyzstan is closed for foreigners (07.2025)
Many cars go from here to Darband.  Say that you are a hitchhiker and that you don’t have money, they will still pick you up.
A doctor in an old ambulance picked us up from here.  Good spot after the point where the road comes together, enough place for cars to stop. And traffic flow towards Khorog is quite high.

Trafic flow is low, but atleast every truck driving here goes to Murgab or to the Chinese border. In our case a truck driver drove to the Chinese border!  But since the pamir highway and the road is so shit, be prepared to drive for 14 hours to the China border!  At one point our truck driver got tired and we had to drive the truck ourselves for over 6 hours.  Good spot, got here by shared taxi which was 50 somoni from Khorog.
Good spot to get a ride to Ishkashim or further.
Perfect spot. There is a police post, where all the cars stop for documents checking. Easy to get the ride to Khorog.

Also not too much traffic, probably because the road construction to Khorog and they close the road for many hours (September 2023). But It seems you can just stand anywhere and you will get the ride once there is a car passing by.
We stayed just near the monument. Not many cars in the early morning, however the second car gave as a short ride.

Walked a bit after the roundabout past the shared taxis. Might take a while to find a free ride as there's many taxis and people asking for money but you will get one eventually. Didn't take me too long to find one to Ayni. Many drive to Khujand.

Took the bus number 3 to the final destination. Once you are out, many taxi drivers will appear so go straight. Many people on the side due to that but many cars and truck coming after the roundabout. The second truck stopped and took me until the big tunnel but with with a bit more luck you could get another one not driving to one of the mines in the surroundings
three times already happened that the driver comes back via unpaved road along to pick me up :)
spot is a bit unpredictable. waiting time varies from minutes to hours. while hitching to Novosibirsk cancel all local cars and you will spend less time on the road

Hard to get here but it's pretty good position right after the tool. Reach bus station \"Rechnoy vokzal\" then walk across the river till the tall.
waiting time from minutes to hours

siberian_explorer

Waited for only a few minutes, but maybe i was lucky (and it helps i'm a female-solo-traveller). There's not so much traffic here, but a truck with military people stopped for me after a short time of waiting.
Same as in Langar, start your way early. 6-7am is good. Traffic is very low, like 1 car per 1-2h. After a few hours we got a ride with 2 military trucks going all the way to Kyzyl Art pass.
There is a village right after border. So just walk further any stop any local car towards Konibodom. Locals are very friendly and helpfull.
Bus 8 (1 Som) or shared taxi no. 8 (3 Som) go along Somoni Ave. They drop you close to the American Embassy from where it's a 20 minutes walk to this roundabout mentioned above.

Look for a transport to Zarafshon district (there is direct trolleybus from President House). Walk approximately 2 km from Zarafshon roundabout to another smaller roundabout. 

siberian_explorer

Except for the empty and abandoned building, the police checkpoint doesn't exist anymore (August 2014). But at least you can still sit there in the shade of the building's walls and wait for a ride (that will come at one point - be optimistic!). BTW: The spot is a 30 minute walk from the bridge in Murghab. I had to wait three hours for the first(!) car to pass, which brought me to Alichur. There I had luck with a Chinese truck (waiting time maybe 30 minutes), which drove all the way to the truck

Here is police checkpoint located. Nice place to spend some time. Police guys will invite you to chat, share some food and let you sleep if you do not want to sleep outside on the wind. Then police guys will ask every passing car to drive you to Khorog. So cool.

Taxibus 3 goes here from Botanical Garden through the town via bazaar. Nice place to h-hike few dozens kms to another village to have some fun with locals there. DON NOT REFUSE INVITATIONS! :) Drink some tea, stay at night. It's worth it!

Follow the road towards China for about 2km from town. Walk past an empty customs terminal to the new one. There will be alot of Chinese trucks in the morning, they stay there for an indefinite time for 'processing'. Some of them will sleep in Murgab, some go to Khorog, some go all the way to Dushanbe. They all leave around a similar time.

take bus#28 from Corvon market till last busstop. here is check point from cars entering the city and speed limit, you can h-hike right after checkpoint

siberian_explorer
Not many cars driving far but eventually will work.
Very few cars but of they drive far, they will pick you up. Make sure it's for free of course.

After the bridge heading towards Dushanbe. Saw the first car after an hour. Chinese border was closed for a week though so normally you would probably see some trucks. Really bad road, don't expect to get far quickly.
Slovenian overlanders picked me up somewhere here, don't remember exact spot. Anywhere works. Road is bad though so slow progress.
Anywhere on this road should work. No need to walk this far.

This is where few locals were hitchhiking too. Some shade under a tree to wait for cars. Not that much traffic, especially going far. Got very lucky with a Chinese couple going all the way Dushanbe. Still better to take this road to Dushanbe than the northern one.
To Panjakent/border. Not as busy as to north towards Khujand but still decent amount of traffic.
Many cars coming and driving within the city. Quiet some space on the side to stopp for especially trucks. After some minutes I had luck with a truck driver who drove all the way to Dushanbe

Got dropped off by a truck after the big tunnel at the street in the middle of nowhere. Right after getting off the first car stopped and took me all the way to Khujand. Some traffic for sure for everyone going to Pandschakent or Khujand so should work fine in general and I guess especially locals are even more helpful and interested to help anybody standing here
Again, very short waiting time for me. There is almost no traffic, so make sure you go to the road early. When there is traffic, they all go to the same direction so that makes it "easier".
Good spot to start hitchhiking the Wakhan Valley

Great spot, as most traffic is going down the lake - be prepared to wait a bit though. Most cars are either already full during high season, or want money. Wait for a truck (as of 07/2025 there are some going regulalry for getting sand from the lake) - we were taken by an old Kamaz truck which was quite the adventure on the mountain pass. Trucks, ofc, are pretty slow though so keep that in mind.
Easy to find a ride to the border or to at least the small town next to it.
A lot of people asking for money but after a while got a ride to Dushanbe for free.
First truck that drove past took me down to the main road.
First truck that drove past took me to the lake for free. Be prepared to wait for a while though, I might've gotten lucky.

Surprisingly a lot of traffic but mostly going to the villages along the way or asking ~20$ to take you to the lake. I waited for a free ride and eventually got one a bit further. A lot of trucks pass here too that mostly take you for free.
Last spot where you can get with public transport of Dushanbe. Either try hitching or use marshrutka to Tursunzade for 0.6 USD.

Again, very easy for me, there was a car with a guy from UK and he had an empty seat for me! He took me from the border to Osh. But only 3 stars because I realize i was lucky. I spoke to a girl later this week and she was stuck at this border for 24h because there was not much traffic (I think weekdays are better??)
Very little trafic, so be prepared to wait a long time. I waited 5 hours and only 5 (full) cars passed. The 6th car offered me a ride!
Don't go too late. In the evening there's barely any traffic going towards the highway, as most tourists leave in the afternoon already.
Traffic flow is very low, but if someone goes here he will probably take you.  Also got the ride after sun down, so don’t let the time discourage you!  It is a very difficult spot you will manage!

This spot really comes down to luck, me and another traveller managed to get a ride from a German couple that drove a camper van, but traffic to Dervoz is very sporadic and on our way to Dervoz, we barely met anyone.  So I would recommend the south route from Dushanbe more.  But if you want to test you luck, go ahead!

Cops are really nice and gave us free watermelon and plov.

This place is infamous for getting stranded as there are no villages beyond here, just alpine desert. Que: no trucks or local cars except short distance farmers. There are tourist cars, but they're often full or not too Hitchhiker friendly, and there arn't loads of them. it's not impossible, but don't expect it to be easy, be prepared to wait a couple of days, don't miss opportunities to hitch, and be open to hitching back to khorog or willing to pay someone with a car at the hostel.

Start your way early. There might be no cars at all afternoon, that was our case and we had to spent a night in Langar. 6-7am is a good time to start. Locals usually don't go to Murgab (super rare), but some of them go on 10-30-50km for a pasture. Most of the cars going to Murgab are tourists (probably a few per days). It's better to wait for a ride at least to Khargush, there is a military base and checkpoint. There is almost nothing else between and high opportunity to stuck in a middle of now

It almost feels like no mans land. If you go here, bring a waterfilter just to be sure! I waited 4 hours and saw 0 cars. The first car I saw had space, so they picked me up! :) my experienxe here is when people have space in the car, they will often take you. So even with almost no traffic, it's still possible. But come prepared to this remote place (water + food).
